clinical_study.brief_title: Reaching Latino Family Dyads to Increase Physical Activity and Healthy Eating
clinical_study.official_title: Tu Salud Â¡Si Cuenta! Reaching Latino Family Dyads to Increase Physical Activity and Healthy Eating

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this research study is to learn about factors that may affect healthy eating and physical activity for Latino families in Houston. Researchers will use this information to design a program to encourage healthy behaviors.

detailed_description.textblock:
To take part in this study, participant will have a study partner. Participant's study partner is another adult living in participant's household. If participant and participant's study partner agrees to take part in this study, participant will participate in the following activities:
- Participant will fill out questionnaires about participant, participant's family, and participant's neighborhood, and about participant's exercise behaviors and the types and amount of food participant usually eats. These questionnaires should take about 1 hour to 1.5 hours to complete.
- Participant will complete a checklist and record the types of foods and beverages present in participant's home. This will include all of the food in participant's refrigerator, freezer, cabinets, countertops, and any other areas where food might be kept. Kitchen appliances and food preparation tools will also be recorded. Study staff will be available to assist participant. This will take about 45 minutes to complete.
- Participant's height, weight, and waist and hip circumference will be measured. To measure participant's waist and hip circumference, participant may be asked to lift participant's shirt to expose participant's stomach area and lower participant's pants to expose participant's mid-hip area. The height, weight, and waist and hip circumference measurements should take about 10 minutes.
- Participant will be given an accelerometer. An accelerometer is a small device that is worn on participant's hip that measures the amount of physical activity participant does. Participant will wear the accelerometer for 7 days and then return it in a pre-addressed envelope provided to participant.
- Within 3 weeks after the study visit, participant will complete a questionnaire over the phone or online, depending on participant's preference, that will ask about the types and amounts of food participant usually eats.
- During the home visit, participant and participant's study partner will be randomly assigned (as in a flip of a coin) to 1 of 2 groups. Participant will have an equal chance of being in any group. These groups differ in the order that questionnaires about the types and amounts of food participant eats are completed. If participant is assigned to group 1, participant will complete a questionnaire called a food frequency questionnaire at the home visit and a questionnaire called a 24-hour recall within 3 weeks after the home visit. If participant is assigned to group 2, participant will complete the 24-hour recall at the home visit and the food frequency questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit.
Length of Study Participation:
Participation in this study will be over after participant completes the questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit and return the accelerometer.
Additional Information:
Participant may be contacted by phone, unencrypted text, unencrypted email, or mail while participant is taking part in this study to remind participant about study procedures (for example, returning the accelerometer). Study staff will only contact participant using the types of communication that participant specifies.
Participant will be asked to give the names and contact information of family members and/or friends for the study staff to contact in the event they cannot reach participant first.
If the accelerometer is lost or stolen, participant will not be responsible for the replacement cost, but participant should tell the study staff right away.
Participant's home address may be used to access public information about the area where participant lives. This is to help researchers learn about how participant's neighborhood encourages physical activity, healthy eating, or other important health behaviors. The results from this study will only be reported as a group and participant will not be identifiable from any products resulting from this study (such as research papers). Participant's home address will never be released or published in any form. Participant's address will be stored separately from other study data, and only the study chair will be able to see the data after the neighborhood information has been collected.
Participant may be contacted in the future to see if participant would agree to take part in other research studies.
Women who are pregnant or thinking about becoming pregnant during the study period will no longer be able to participate. If participant becomes pregnant during this study, please tell the study staff right away.
This is an investigational study. Up to 120 participants total will take part in this study, and up to 48 will take part in this part (the home visit portion) of the study. All will be enrolled at MD Anderson.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify Perceived Determinants of Healthy Eating and Physical Activity (PA) in Latino Families Determined by Questionnaires
Identify Perceived Determinants of Healthy Eating and Physical Activity (PA) in Latino Families Determined from Interviews

arm_group.description: Participants undergo immersive assessment involving examination of the home food and physical activity (PA) environments, objective and self-reported PA, nutritional intake, and demographics and relevant psychosocial measures. Participants complete a self-administered household food inventory (HFI). Participants to wear an accelerometer device for 7 consecutive days to measure physical activity. Participants complete a food frequency questionnaire at the home visit, and a 24-hour recall questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit. Open-ended, in-depth interviews conducted with up to 24 Latino family dyads to explore attitudes, behaviors, barriers and facilitators, and social support related to healthy eating and PA, with a particular emphasis on the family dyad context.

Participants undergo immersive assessment involving examination of the home food and physical activity (PA) environments, objective and self-reported PA, nutritional intake, and demographics and relevant psychosocial measures. Participants complete a self-administered household food inventory (HFI). Participants to wear an accelerometer device for 7 consecutive days to measure physical activity. Participants complete a 24-hour recall questionnaire at the home visit, and a food frequency questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit. Open-ended, in-depth interviews conducted with up to 24 Latino family dyads to explore attitudes, behaviors, barriers and facilitators, and social support related to healthy eating and PA, with a particular emphasis on the family dyad context.

intervention.description: Participants undergo immersive assessment involving examination of the home food and physical activity (PA) environments, objective and self-reported PA, nutritional intake, and demographics and relevant psychosocial measures.
Participants complete a self-administered household food inventory (HFI).
Participants to wear an accelerometer device for 7 consecutive days to measure physical activity.

Group 1: Participants complete a food frequency questionnaire at the home visit, and a 24-hour recall questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit. Group 2: Participants complete a 24-hour recall questionnaire at the home visit, and a food frequency questionnaire within 3 weeks after the home visit.

Open-ended, in-depth interviews conducted with up to 24 Latino family dyads to explore attitudes, behaviors, barriers and facilitators, and social support related to healthy eating and PA, with a particular emphasis on the family dyad context.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Self-reported Hispanic/Latino ethnicity
2. Age 18-65 years
3. Speak English or Spanish
4. Physically able to engage in low-to-moderate PA
5. Consumption of fewer than 5 servings of fruits and vegetables per day
6. Valid home address in the Houston neighborhoods of Gulfton, the East End/Magnolia, or Near Northside, or adjacent neighborhoods
7. Working telephone number
Exclusion Criteria:
1) Pregnancy at any point during the study period OR considering pregnancy during the study period

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
